Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
On 9/14/22, staff at facility place youth in an unwarranted restraint.
INVESTIGATION:
Information for this complaint was discovered by the consultant when reviewing
incident reports involving restraints on September 19, 2022.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Youth A
described running around the cabin while at Quest and refusing to take her
medication. Youth A stated Youth C called her “stupid,” and Youth A became upset
because of the name calling. Youth A reported she threw a lotion bottle in the
direction of Youth C, but not really at Youth C because she was “so mad.” Youth A
stated she then ran to the cabin door because she wanted to leave the cabin. Youth
A denied running toward Youth C, denied Youth C coming towards her or any other
exchange occurring between herself and Youth C. Youth A stated Staff 2 placed her
in a restraint. Supervisor entered the cabin switched out Staff 2 and the restraint was
discontinued. Youth A stated she was placed in the restraint for throwing the lotion
bottle and did not have concerns with how the restraint was performed.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Youth B
reported there was “drama” with the girls during Quest and refused to answer any
other questions.
2

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Youth C
stated Youth A was refusing to take her medication, so Staff 2 was trying to explain
to Youth A why she needed to take the medication. Youth C reported she told Youth
A she was “fucking stupid”, and Youth A threw something at her so, Staff 2 placed
Youth A in a restraint. Youth C could not recall what Youth A threw at her. Youth C
denied Youth A saying or doing anything else toward her. Youth C denied saying or
doing anything else toward Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Youth D
described Youth A running around the cabin and refusing to take her medication.
Youth D stated Staff 2 was trying to get Youth A to take her medication, when Youth
C called Youth A a “dumb ass.” Youth D stated Youth A then threw a shoe or
something at Youth C and attempted to walk out of the cabin. Youth D reported
Staff 2 placed Youth A in a restraint. Youth D denied Youth A doing anything other
than throwing an object at Youth C and stated Youth C did not react. Youth D
denied having any concerns with the restraint.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Youth E
stated she was sitting on the floor of the cabin with Youth C and Youth D laughing
about something that happened earlier in the day. Youth E reported Youth C called
Youth A a “dumb bitch” and Youth A threw a Dove lotion bottle at Youth C. Youth E
stated Staff 2 restrained Youth A for throwing the bottle. Youth E denied any other
actions taking place between Youth A and Youth C. Youth E stated she did not
have any concern with the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Staff 1
described Youth A as being dysregulated, running around the cabin at Quest and
refusing to take her medication. Staff 1 reported Youth C said something to Youth
A, Youth A got upset and threw a lotion bottle at Youth C. Staff 1 said after Youth A
threw the lotion bottle, she darted for the cabin door so Staff 2 placed Youth A in a
restraint. Staff 1 stated she thinks Youth A and Youth C exchanged more words
with one another but was not certain. Staff 1 described Supervisor coming into the
cabin and switching out Staff 2. Staff 1 stated Supervisor was able to talk with Youth
A and calm her down. Staff 1 stated she personally would not have placed Youth A
in a restraint. Staff 1 reported she would have let Youth A go outside because she
believed Youth A was trying to go talk with Supervisor who she is close to. Staff 1
denied Youth A trying to attack Youth C or Youth A threatening to harm herself.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on September 21, 2022. Staff 2
reported Youth A received bad news that her pre-adoptive family backed out, so she
was running around the cabin and refusing to take her medication. Staff 2 stated
Youth C told Youth A she was stupid, and Youth A threw a lotion container at Youth
C. Staff 2 reported Youth A had a lot of “aggression” and came toward her as Staff
2 was standing in front of the cabin door. Staff 2 stated Youth A could not verbalize
what her intentions were and stated again Youth A was being aggressive. Staff 2
3

was asked to describe what she meant by “aggressive.” Staff 2 described Youth A
yelling but denied that Youth A was hitting/punching or going after Youth C. Staff 2
stated she placed Youth A in a restraint because it was late, dark outside and she
was not sure what Youth A was going to do. Staff 2 reported there were three staff
outside, one being Supervisor, who came into the cabin and switched her out from
the restraint. Staff 2 reported she felt the restraint was warranted and done properly.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone while I was at the facility on September
21, 2022. Supervisor reported she was outside standing by the fire with two other
staff when she heard commotion from inside the cabin. Supervisor stated she
entered the cabin, saw Staff 2 in a restraint with Youth A and took over the restraint.
Supervisor reported she continued the restraint for about 15 seconds until Youth A
became calm. Supervisor denied seeing what happened leading up to the restraint.
Supervisor described talking with Youth A and Staff 2 about the restraint as well as
reviewing the incident report. Supervisor stated Staff 2 told her Youth A headed
toward the door aggressively but did not describe what aggressively looked like.
Supervisor reported she felt the restraint was warranted due to the situation Staff 2
was placed in.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 2
completed the required Aegis training on 03/17/22 and 03/18/22.
• Incident Report 141510196 was not consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2,
Supervisor or Youth A’s interviews. The incident report did not reflect
Supervisor was involved in the restraint. Supervisor reported she spoke with
Quality Assurance about some key points not being in the incident report and
struggling to get Wifi while at Quest.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4160 Emergency Restraint
Rule 160. The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving
response for a youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others
from an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior
that places the youth or others at serious threat of
violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
(b) When all other interventions in the agency’s crisis
prevention and intervention plan and the youth’s
individual safety and calming plan have been utilized
but fail to protect the youth or others from
unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence
or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
4

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 2 placed Youth A
in a restraint for throwing a lotion bottle at Youth C, then running
toward the door and attempting to push past Staff 2. The
physical restraint was not warranted.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
